item.title: XV2, Our New Automatic Pollinating and Harvesting Robot
item.description: HarvestX Inc. (Head office: Bunkyo-Ku, Tokyo; President: Yuki Ichikawa) released XV2, a new automatic pollinating and harvesting robot prototype with higher mobility and efficiency than the previous prototype. New Features of XV2 Suitable for multi-layer vertical farming system Autonomous driving by magnetic guidance system Equipped with a function to change harvesting trays to increase loading capacity of harvested strawberries With this new robot specialized for plant factories, we will continue to develop products with even greater adaptability to the actual cultivation environment.

item.title: We established HarvestX Lab, a research and development facility for robotic systems
item.description: HarvestX Inc. (Head office: Bunkyo-Ku, Tokyo; President: Yuki Ichikawa) established HarvestX Lab, a research and development facility for fully automated strawberry cultivation robot system, in the University of Tokyo Entrepreneur Lab. HarvestX Lab is a dedicated R&D facility where we can conduct tests throughout the year in order to add more items for verification and evaluation of the robot system and to accelerate the testing cycle. By using the same cultivation facilities as those of plant factory companies, we will reduce the difference between the development environment and the operation environment, and aim to improve the functions and quality of our products.

item.title: We have raised a total of 50 million yen in funding.
item.description: HarvestX Inc. (Head office: Bunkyo-Ku, Tokyo; President: Yuki Ichikawa) has raised a total of 50 million yen in funding from independent venture capital “ANRI No.4 Investment Limited Partnership” (Representative: Anri Samata), the Open Innovation Promotion No. 1 Investment Limited Partnership managed by the University of Tokyo Innovation Platform Co., Ltd. (Headquarters: Hongo, Bunkyo-Ku, Tokyo; President: Katsuhiko Oizumi), Soichiro Kawai, Keisuke Sogawa, and Kunihiro Tanaka. Press release(Japanese)

item.title: HarvestX has been selected to UTokyo IPC 1st Round
item.description: HarvestX has been selected to the ‘1st Round’, an incubation program run by UTokyo IPC(Innovation Platform for the University of Tokyo). Press release UTokyo IPC: https://www.utokyo-ipc.co.jp/2020/10/utokyoipc-1stround_3rd_final/ (Japanese)
